result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy Roberta Streubel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $518.00  including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Pay any restitution that is requested.  Restitution to be held open for 30 days.  1 week for objections once restitutions is submitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy Roberta Streubel

records.addlTxt: DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty acknowledged receipt of information.  Continues to plea/sentencing.

Atty Chapman indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Moves to arraignment.

1:44 PM Defendant Tammy Roberta Streubel appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Tammy Roberta Streubel.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire electronically submitted to Court.   Court addresses the DEF as to right to appear in person, DEF wishes to proceed by video.   State recites the agreement, all parties agree.   Moves to waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.    Court reviews the information,   DEF enters Guilty.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.  State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.   Attny Chapman makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement to court.   Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  COURT:  Withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Conditions of probation:  Pay any restitution that is requested.  Restitution to be held open for 30 days.  1 week for objections once restitutions is submitted.  Court Costs.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    29 days credit.

9:51 AM Defendant Tammy Roberta Streubel appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Tammy Roberta Streubel.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Attny Chapman makes bond argument.  State objects to bond modification.  Court makes statement as to bond modification and treatment.  Court denies bond motion.  Attny Chapman request preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address. Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation and also states she has two open cases in addition. Atty Otten argues bond. Court makes reference to DEF other cases in Sawyer County. Court sets bond. Case to track with other cases.
